attributes.comment:
To Whom It May Concern: It is my understanding that this fee increase proposal
would substantially raise filing fees for most types of adoption related cases. I
believe if the proposed rule is adopted, filing fees would increase by an average of
66% over current fees.

As a prospective adoptive parent, my greatest concern are the adoption-related
petitions affected by the proposed increase:

I-600/600A (Petition to Classify Orphan as an Immediate Relative)

$545 to $670

N-565 (Application for Replacement of Certificate of Citizenship (used for
name changes)

$220 to $380

N-600 (Application for Certificate of Citizenship)

$255 to $460

Biometric Services (fingerprints)

$70 to $80

Adoption is expensive enough already, and it is unconscionable to
raise fees by up to 66% for adoption-related petitions.

Please consider the negative effects this proposal can have on prospective
adoptive parents, and the children that are waiting to be adopted.

Thank you.

Sincerely,
PAP (Prospective Adoptive Parent)

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Anonymous
